base_note.note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-08-12
Patient: Carol Davis | MRN: 9707634 | Age: 74F
Attending: Dr. James Wilson, MD
Location: MICU, Brigham and Women's Hospital

INDICATION: 74F on mechanical ventilation for respiratory failure. New RLL collapse on CXR. Suspected mucus plugging.

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with therapeutic aspiration

ANESTHESIA: Already sedated/paralyzed on ventilator

FINDINGS:
- ETT: 7.5mm at 22cm, no granulation
- Trachea: Copious thick yellow secretions
- RMS: Thick mucus plug at RMS/BI junction
- RLL: Complete mucus impaction with cast
- Left lung: Moderate secretions

PROCEDURE: Extensive suctioning performed. Large mucus cast removed from RLL basal segments using suction and saline lavage. Post-procedure, all segments patent.

SPECIMENS: Secretions sent for culture

POST-PROCEDURE: CXR showed re-expansion of RLL. Ventilator weaning resumed.

Dr. James Wilson, MD

code_rationales.31645: Therapeutic aspiration for mucus plugging causing lobar atelectasis.

coding_review.overall_assessment: 31645 appropriate for significant mucus plugging causing collapse, distinct from simple suctioning.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree, initial

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Stephen Cooper
Medical Record Number: 9904307
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-09-02

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with mucus plugging with lobar collapse. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Therapeutic Aspiration:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
- ETT: 7.5mm at 22cm, no granulation
- Trachea: Copious thick yellow secretions
- RMS: Thick mucus plug at RMS/BI junction
- RLL: Complete mucus impaction with cast
- Left lung: Moderate secretions


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31645

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-03-04
Patient: Christian Gonzales
MRN: 6552589
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Mucus plugging with lobar collapse

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
General

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Therapeutic Aspiration performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
Secretions sent for culture

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
ICU

CPT CODES: 31645

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-04-12, Walter Li, a None-year-old patient (MRN 5713901), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Mucus plugging with lobar collapse. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included therapeutic aspiration. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The visualized airways appeared patent without significant abnormality. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is mucus plugging. 

Procedural coding: 31645.

BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-08-10
Patient: Carlos Allen | MRN: 2599005 | Age: 74F
Attending: Dr. James Wilson, MD
Location: MICU, Brigham and Women's Hospital

INDICATION: 74F on mechanical ventilation for respiratory failure. New RLL collapse on CXR. Suspected mucus plugging.

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with therapeutic aspiration

ANESTHESIA: Already sedated/paralyzed on ventilator

FINDINGS:
- ETT: 7.5mm at 22cm, no granulation
- Trachea: Copious thick yellow secretions
- RMS: Thick mucus plug at RMS/BI junction
- RLL: Complete mucus impaction with cast
- Left lung: Moderate secretions

PROCEDURE: Extensive suctioning carried out. Large mucus cast excised from RLL basal segments using suction and saline lavage. Post-procedure, all segments clear.

SPECIMENS: Secretions sent for culture

POST-PROCEDURE: CXR revealed re-expansion of RLL. Ventilator weaning resumed.

Dr. James Wilson, MD
